9b7bff23-47b4-4df1-81ca-b66542cb8238.description: Badge-earners completed a twelve-week-long online workshop on causal modeling and causal inference in applied machine learning and data science contexts. Course assessments required the use of Python libraries, including deep probabilistic modeling in PyTorch (Pyro), to implement causal reasoning algorithms. As a result, they have gained the ability to build causal reasoning algorithms into decision-making systems in data science and machine learning teams at top-tier technology organizations.
9b7bff23-47b4-4df1-81ca-b66542cb8238.name: Causal Modeling In Machine Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete a 12-week online code-first workshop that covers core causal modeling fundamentals, applied causal inference techniques, and algorithmic counterfactual reasoning.

Submit coding assignments in Python.  Assignments include use of probabilistic modeling in Pytorch to implement causal models.  Upon completion, badge-earners complete assessments based on lecture and assignment content.

09ba4e58-9001-4bdd-8386-eb7aab7e0be8.description: This a 12 weeks-long practical Bayesian modeling and probabilistic machine learning workshop. The instruction portion builds on the skills badge earners with a proven model-building workflow. This workshop forces on how can we turn our experts' domain knowledge into computable artifacts that we own and how can we go beyond simple importing of libraries to building models and model artifacts that grow in value over time.
09ba4e58-9001-4bdd-8386-eb7aab7e0be8.name: Modern Probabilistic Modeler

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete a 12-week online code-first workshop that covers core Bayesian fundamentals, applied probabilistic modeling and generative machine learning techniques, and fundamentals of probabilistic programming.

Submit coding assignments in Python. Assignments include use of probabilistic modeling in Pytorch to implement causal models. Upon completion, badge-earners complete assessments based on lecture and assignment content.
